titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia Lewis O 33: Majmūʻah.

notesStmt.note: Two owner's stamps with the names Aḥmad and Jalāl visible (flyleaf 2 recto).

msContents.summary: Collection of nine different works in different hands, in both Arabic and Persian. Several blank leaves between each work or set of works.

author.persName: Zarnūjī, Burhān al-Dīn, active 12th century-13th century
Farāhī, Abū Naṣr Muḥammad Badr al-Dīn
فراهي، ابو نصر محمد بدر الدين
Ṭanṭarānī, Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Razzāq, active 11th century
Rāzī, Muḥammad ibn Abī Bakr, active 1261

author.name: Free Library of Philadelphia. Rare Book Department. John Frederick Lewis Collection of Oriental Manuscripts

msItem.title: Taʻlīm al-mutaʻallim fī ṭarīq al-taʻallum / Burhān al-Dīn al-Zarnūjī
[Selection of sayings in prose from the Prophet and Imams]
Niṣāb al-ṣibyān / Abū Naṣr Muḥammad Badr al-Dīn al-Farāhī
al-Qaṣīdah al-Ṭanṭarānīyah / Aḥmad ibn ʻAbd al-Razzāq al-Ṭanṭarānī
[Selection from Mukhtār al-Ṣiḥāḥ with the heading Qāʻidat al-nafīsah]

supportDesc.extent: 81 leaves : 203 x 114 (145 x 68) mm bound to 200 x 117 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added in pencil, upper left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

layoutDesc.layout: Prose sections, 19 long lines; poetry sections, 15 lines in two columns or with staggered lines. Frame ruled with a misṭarah.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Chiefly written in nastaʻlīq in black ink; pointed.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrications in red. Some pages are border-ruled in red. Some headings are set off by blue rules.

binding.p: Bound in brown leather over pasteboard with flap (Type II). Blind stamped central mandorla on front and back with coordinating stamp on flap. Gold tooled frame and mandorla outline. Light green doublure.

origin.p: Item is undated, but probably copied between the end of the 17th and first half of the 18th century.

history.provenance: Gift of Anne Baker Lewis in 1933.
Formerly owned by Muḥammad ʻAlī Mushtāq (stamp f. 1v).
Formerly owned by Elias A. Khouri (note in pencil flyleaf 1 recto at front of book).
Formerly owned by John Frederick Lewis.

keywords.term: Arabic language--Study and teaching--Early works to 1800

surface.n: Inside back cover flap open to show design
Back cover flap opened to show design
Fore edge flap closed, inside front cover
